channel.title: Bev Gray
channel.description: Bev Gray (Remarks as Prepared for Delivery)

item.title: Imagine, working every day for four years without a paycheck. I did.
item.author: Bev Gray

item.title: I worked while our children, Jessica and Kevin, played and napped. And after I tucked them into bed, I worked.
item.author: Bev Gray

item.title: Our first nine months, we had one client -- a client who waited six months to pay us.
item.author: Bev Gray

item.title: We sustained our business by tapping into our personal credit cards and borrowing against our home.
item.author: Bev Gray

item.title: The commitments, expenses and the stress kept us up at night, but we were determined to build a successful business.
item.author: Bev Gray

item.title: And after several years of hard work, long hours, no pay and low pay, we did.
item.author: Bev Gray

item.title: Today, Exhibit Edge employs 20 people and helps businesses grow through trade show marketing. When those businesses grow, they employ people.
item.author: Bev Gray

item.title: The President said that business owners didn't get there on our own.
item.author: Bev Gray

item.title: We risked everything and succeeded because of our hard work and commitment.
item.author: Bev Gray

item.title: What President Obama doesn't understand is that when businesses grow, unemployment goes down and people thrive.
item.author: Bev Gray

item.title: We need a president who understands the value of entrepreneurship. Governor Romney knows and, more importantly, appreciates what it takes to build a successful business, and that's why I'm supporting Mitt Romney.
item.author: Bev Gray
